Clue: Proposed name I don't change (9)
Tough guys breaking ribs? Sure! (8)
File in woodland getting lost (8)
Utopian novel italicised (10)
Agreed toe is deformed somewhat (2,1,6)
Sterile unit fenced off (10)
Tricky problem, brewing artisan beer (5-6)
Promise to fix toilet pan (9)
Smear pan to cook cheese (8)
Sibling ignoring the second disturbance (6)
Explanation: Ignore the second letter in “brother” (sibling) to get “bother”

Clue: I'm taken aback by anger? That's an illusion (6)
Explanation: MIRAGE - reversal (taken aback) of I'M, + RAGE (anger)

Clue: Leave on Christmas morning, possibly with papa (6)
Explanation: DECAMP - DEC AM P (code word for the letter P)

Clue: Magic transport needs fourth of combustion chambers to run like clockwork (10)
Explanation: Combine “b” for “fourth of combustion”, “rooms” for “chambers” and “tick” for “to run like clockwork”

Clue: Refuse a black mark (7)
Explanation: Combine “a” and “b” for black and “stain” - synonym for “mark”

Clue: It may get endless representation (5)
Explanation: “endless” means take everything except last letters of “it may get”

Clue: Chap gets older but copes (7)
Sound beginning when hummingbird is rapidly returning (5)
Explanation: “beginning” means take the first letters in “when hummingbird is rapidly returning”

Clue: Loco caught by travelling icon, always on the move (7)
Everyone in short dash for US city (6)
European power limited by genuine revocation (6)
Cursed, being literally last in bed (7)
Trap surrounded by enchantment is irresistible (8)
Standard offer of a choice of ends for Nottingham (8)
Explanation: Put “or” for “choice” between the ends of “nottingham” - “n” and “m”

Clue: Cuckoo making beastly noise (7)
Encouraging sign from sleepy land? (3)
Explanation: Double definition: “encouraging sign” meaning nod of approval and “sleepy land” - a land of nod

Clue: Back in a short while (6)
Wear out an important part of a car (4)
Definition: wear out / important part of a car
Explanation: Double definition: “wear out” and “an important part of a car”

Clue: Stipulations for academic periods (5)
My virtue (8)
Explanation: Double definition: the first an exclamation of surprise “my goodness” and “virtue” is a synonym

Clue: Sprite seen in hotel foyer (3)
Error concealed by city police (4)
In Berlin, dainty girl (5)
Singer in first ENO Rigoletto (5)
Section of Norman arch is thrown into disorder? (9)
Explanation: hidden word in “NormAN ARCH IS Thrown”

Clue: Soft cases used by opera violinists (7)
Begin to understand material one doesn't finish (6,2)
Explanation: COTTON ON - COTTON (material) + ON{e} (one doesn't finish, i.e. "one" without its last letter)

Clue: Tie up an awkward flower (7)
Uncommon sense in a German city (5)
Encouraging word for Charlie's predecessor (5)
Explanation: BRAVO - double definition, the second referring to the letter names used in, e.g., the NATO phonetic alphabet (Alfa/Alpha, Bravo, Charlie, etc)

Clue: Initiation that's suitable is in British Museum (7)
Explanation: BAPTISM - APT (suitable) + IS, all inside BM (British Museum)

Clue: Family member doesn't start to let loose (5)
Explanation: UNTIE - {A}UNTIE (Family member doesn't start, i.e. "Auntie" without its initial letter)

Clue: Province in actual centre of Germany (5)
Explanation: REALM - REAL (actual) + {Ger}M{any} (centre of Germany, i.e. the middle letter of "Germany")

Clue: Simple dish — not as snob ate in mess (5,2,5)
Explanation: “in mess” indicates anagram of “not as snob ate”

Clue: Extremely desirable drug store (5)
Explanation: DEPOT - D{esirabl}E (Extremely desirable, i.e. the first and last letters of "desirable") + POT (drug)

Clue: Youngster swallows large part of tooth (4)
Lights finally low, central heating on, kiss and cuddle (6)
Scrub fork clean for a bit of breakfast (9)
Burned remains after emptying secret store (5)
Loss of earnings shocking to Mexican (6,3)
Router sends digger round Bath (10)
Smile, darling, although missing a tooth (7)
Saying little boy almost in shape for ice cream? (7)
Explanation: LACONIC - LA{d} + CONIC [in shape for ice cream]

Clue: See blonde squirming: why is she red in the face? (9)
Definition: why is she red in the face

Clue: Portrait of animal so original (4,4)
Speak badly of drug, taken regularly in tiny amount (7)
Palladium, introducing old character, cut back (6)
A couple of lines crossing everywhere (3,4)
Beatle's back in USSR, playing tricks (5)
Check a Buddhist at regular intervals (5)
Explanation: AUDIT - A [b}U[d]D[h]I[s]T, an amusing idea, with a team of accountants examining the books at the temple.

Clue: Worker occasionally draws injured people (10)
Explanation: CASUALTIES - CASUAL + TIES, once again a brilliant surface that is hard to break down.

Clue: Break out with Toad's means of locomotion (10)
Trifling child (5)
Begin to deal with notice on deck (7)
Explanation: ADDRESS - AD + DRESS, in the sense of deck the halls.

Clue: In airport goddess replaces old Christian (8)
Explanation: LUTHERAN -  LUT{-o,+HERA]N.   A brtilliant clue, where a whole word is substituted for a letter.

Clue: Stand for show again? (9)
Explanation: REPRESENT - Double definition, the second one semi-jocular.

Clue: Stop outside or go (6)
Letters from schoolmaster never enforcing discipline (5)
Aspic possibly combined with pepper (8)
Busts are terribly hard to grasp (8)
Introduce American drug, ignoring blood group (5,2)
No fewer than fifty each in a test (not English) (2,5)
Explanation: AT LEAST - AT(L EA)[e]ST, a rather elaborate clue for an obvious answer.

Clue: Strong feeling about large person fastening flies? (6)
Explanation: ANGLER - ANG(L)ER.   An angler, however, does not necessarily tie his own flies, althought it is traditional to do so.

Clue: Financial supporter not available to back hairdressing product (5)
Explanation: ANGEL - NA (not available) reversed [back], GEL (hairdressing product). I first came across this type of angel as backers who invest in theatrical productions, but it can also be used for other kinds of enterprise.

Clue: Lowest emotional point of commemoration: a dirge (5)
The aim's to change a lack of belief in god (7)
Reveal temperature in Spanish city (3,2)
Explanation: LET ON - T (temperature) contained by [in]  LEÓN (Spanish city).

Clue: Again plan harvest around first of May (5)
Trade show open (4)
Explanation: FAIR - Two meanings, the second as in 'open and honest'

Clue: Unmarried man excited Chloe in pub (8)
Explanation: BACHELOR - Anagram [excited] of CHLOE contained by [in] BAR (pub)

Clue: School prize went to son, finally (4)
Place to set free American skunk (7)
Only partially sanguine about money (6)
One not allowing large headline (6)
The French dine from feeding trough (6)
Explanation: MANGER - two definitions, one not really an English definition as such so I’ll consider it wordplay.

Clue: Rock walls enable repression (10)
Explanation: SWALLOWING - SW(ALLOW)ING. If you swallow emotions, for instance, you repress them.

Clue: Timmy Thompson’s secret fantasy (4)
Explanation: MYTH - contained in ‘Timmy Thompson’. I guess it’s ‘secret’ in the sense that it’s hidden inside.

Clue: Don’t have to leave (2,7)
Explanation: GO WITHOUT - I’m not sure about the second part of this clue. Is it synonymous with ‘go outside’, i.e. ‘depart’ or is it referring to ‘leaving’ something on your plate, for instance? The latter makes a bit more sense to me but it’s exactly the same meaning as the first half of the clue. I suppose that’s allowed!

Clue: In which to wash pot (4)
Explanation: SINK - DD. The second definition is a billiards reference.

Clue: Provisional licence obtained? (9)
Explanation: QUALIFIED - two definitions, one slightly oblique.

Clue: Like part of viewer’s money invested in Madrid team (7)
English architect and landscape gardener known in Scotland (4)
Definition: english architect and landscape gardener / known in scotland
Explanation: KENT - double definition, a fellow I had never heard of, but easily gettable.

Clue: Hat that’s extremely comfortable crossing northern lake (6)
Explanation: CLOCHE - C(LOCH)E, where the enclosing letters come from C[omfortabl]E.

Clue: Arab friend — European gets one for nothing (11)
Explanation: PALESTINIAN - PAL (friend) + ESTONIAN (European) with I instead of O

Clue: Scotland’s own Foreign Department (3)
Explanation: AIN - dd, the first the Scottish word for "own", the second a department in eastern France. There didn't seem to be any likelier option for A?N but I can't say that either of these meanings emerged from my memory with any great sense of familiarity.

Clue: Ridiculous in a suit in the country (7)
Praise silent type, advancing initially into battle (11)
Explanation: ACCLAMATION - CLAM (silent type) + A (advancing initally), in ACTION (battle)

Clue: Make altogether disgusting (5)
In getting up fast, I remedy fault (7)
Explanation: DEMERIT - hidden reversed in fasT I REMEDy

Clue: Prepare vegetables and quickly see to baby (3,3,4)
Definition: prepare vegetables / quickly see to baby
Explanation: TOP AND TAIL - dd, though I didn't know the second meaning, which is (Chambers): "To wash (a baby's) face and buttocks"

Clue: Traditional accompaniments that are cut off (9)
Boat that leads the way for others? (7)
Definition: boat / that leads the way for others
Explanation: LIGHTER - one of Chambers' definitions for light is: "(transitive verb) To follow or precede (someone, or his or her path) with a light", so a person leading the way could perhaps be called a lighter

Clue: Useless worker endlessly about to finish cell extension (7)
Explanation: DENDRON - DRON{e} (Useless worker endlessly) around END (to finish), to give (Chambers): "A branching projection of a nerve cell". Not a word I knew but it seemed believable as I knew of other dendr- words.

Clue: Man I have heard on the radio (5)
Definition: man / i have heard on the radio
Explanation: ROGER - dd, the second referring to (Chambers): "A word used in signalling and radio-communication for R, in the sense of received (and understood)"

Clue: Hoofed mammal in Kansas occasionally (3)
Explanation: ASS - every other letter from (occasionally) kAnSaS.

Clue: Mischievous goddess had some food (3)
Explanation: ATE - double definition. Ate is the Greek goddess of mischief and ruin.

Clue: Rescue dog losing tail (8)
Explanation: RETRIEVE - RETRIEVEr (dog) minus its last letter (losing tail).

Clue: Fish holding short stick in biannual event (8)
Explanation: SOLSTICE - SOLE (fish) containing (holding) all-but-the-last letter of (short) STICk.

Clue: Compound kept by some Westerners (5)
Explanation: ESTER - Hidden (indicated by "kept by some") in wESTERners, giving a type of chemical compound

Clue: Trade vehicles (7)
Some prefer a lion that's untamed (5)
Explanation: FERAL - Hidden (indicated by "some") in preFER A Lion

Clue: City offering what’s collected in box for down-and-outs (6)
Weapons found in farmstead (4)
For example, one / sort of anaesthetic (6)
Definition: for example, one / sort of anaesthetic

Clue: Quieter part of distillery (7)
Sprinter, perhaps, allowed in running heat (7)
Explanation: ATHLETE - LET (allowed) inside an anagram of (running) HEAT.

Clue: Movable chair some used anywhere (5)
Change designation of item, an error partly reversed (6)
Explanation: RENAME - Hidden reverse (indicated by partly and reversed respectively) in itEM AN ERror

Clue: Proudly claim vessel carries spades (5)
Explanation: BOAST - BOAT (vessel) 'carries' an S (spades in bridge notation)

Clue: Maybe Tom from Warrington, one with a lingering happy expression (8,3)
Definition: maybe tom from warrington / one with lingering happy expression
Explanation: CHESHIRE CAT - DD, the first being a pleasant cryptic (Tom cat and Warrington being a town in Cheshire)

Clue: Firm multiplied by showing work of Dickens (4,5)
Safe place to jump (5)
Certain about Chile’s capital being somewhere in the Andes (5)
No tears about disloyalty (7)
Trinity right within you (5)
This country is in ruin — am I biased? (7)
Explanation: NAMIBIA - The African nation is indeed 'in' ruiN AM I BIAsed

Clue: Come gallantly holding final letter (5)
Explanation: OMEGA - Hidden in (indicated by 'holding') cOME GAllantly

Clue: Dairy product a girl takes in bed (7)
Explanation: RICOTTA - COT in RITA (random, typically uneducated, woman)

Clue: Put friend in the picture in a relaxed way (10)
Guy from Egypt he obliges (4)
Explanation: THEO - hidden word: EgypT HE Obliges.

Clue: Find beer possibly as favour (8)
Explanation: BEFRIEND - straight anagram ('possibly') of FIND BEER = BEFRIEND.

Clue: Warm and moist — like some marine life? (6)
Definition: warm and moist / like some marine life
Explanation: another double definition, the second one a touch whimsical.

Clue: Thriving source of water (4)
Deep thought: odd state to beset one (10)
Explanation: RUM NATION, around I for one.

Clue: Monkey lives around borders of Kenya, to the west (4)
Explanation: IS around K{eny}A, all written right to left. I didn’t know the monkey, but I did know there was a humourist who called himself SAKI, so I could guess where the name came from.

Clue: Passage which crosses river, ending in Idaho (6)
Explanation: THAT (which), around R (river) and O (ending in “Idaho”).

Clue: A silencing word remains (3)
Just this for Latin scholar, with others hanging around (7)
Explanation: HIC [this, for Latin scholar] with ET AL [others] "hanging around”

Clue: Be sad for us in midst of glumness (5)
Very harmful to take out city on Atlantic coast, American (11)
Explanation: DELETE RIO US [take out | city on Atlantic coast | American]

Clue: Geographical area in study with infestation by insect (6)
Surrounded by a fog, holding on to daughter (6)
Explanation: A MIST [a fog], "holding on to" D [daughter]

Clue: Is jabbing American after somewhat cheeky expression of age (8)
Doctor locates legible astronomical reference (9,5)
Suspends comments about post finally (5)
Smashed single forehand? I'm not upset (2,4,8)
Steep drop in price amended, then restated without right (9)
Explanation: (PRICE*) ["amended"] + P{r}ICE [price again, this time minus R for right]

Clue: A story with beginning repeated is easily approached (7)
Explanation: A F-FABLE [a | story, with (its first letter) repeated]

Clue: Boy with it turns, following effect of the moon? (5)
Relaxation involves identification of alternative holiday venue (6)
Explanation: REST [relaxation] involves OR [identification of alternative, wordily enough]

Clue: Woman impresses youngster, eating a Mexican dish (9)
Material in patch in overalls (5)
Trial in US city making the news (6)
I very much refuse to consider weather indicator (6)
Explanation: I SO BAR [I | very much | refuse to consider]

Clue: Historic city reduced in particular view of the past (10)

Explanation: BLAKE [poet] moving {vers}E up a couple of letters

Clue: With pride, she loses in brawling (7)
Design on cent’s piece coined for particular occasion (5)
Explanation: hidden in [desig]N ON CE[nt], just biffed by me.

Clue: Server misses one playing pool game (5,4)
Explanation: WA[i]TER + anagram of POOL.   I biffed, and did not even realize 'pool' was not part of the definition - which it easily could be

Clue: Learner in military group not exactly bright (5)
Explanation: UN(L)IT, a relief from the usual chestnut.

Explanation: RELATIVE + anagram of POOR NUN.   The DBE is clearly indicated by the question mark.

Clue: Under emotional pressure in past? (5)
Explanation: double definition, where the DBE of the literal is again indicated by a question mark.

Clue: Man, say, in Paisley (4)
Shrub with red or white flowers — unusually red alone (8)
Definition: shrub with red or white flowers

Clue: Paraffin oil’s odd treatment for sore knee (8)
Explanation: anagram of (odd treatment for) SORE KNEES.

Clue: Rue eroticism that’s deviant and only superficially attractive (12)
Short word some feel bally son omitted to send back (12)
Explanation: hidden in (some) a reversal of (to send back) feEL BALLY SON OMitted.

Ate some shortbread in Edinburgh (5)
New throne for queen, perhaps (6)
Explanation: *(THRONE) with "new" signposting the anagram.  The female hornet is a queen: did not know this, but seemed eminently plausible on the basis of a queen bee so in it went…

Clue: Former heads of our legal department (3)
Explanation: First letters of (heads of) Our Legal Department

Explanation: Reverse hidden (caught up)  in extractOR FAn

Explanation: Hidden in "some" of the letters of discontenT ON GAllant

Explanation: double definition, a heavy = a guard, etc. Nice!
